comments:
2016 Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 3.

From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

clues.clue: Correct, it's the name given to this type of angle
It describes these two angles that tell you how lovely & terrific you are
Aw, it's the type of angle seen here
Additionally, it describes the angles here
It's the reactionary name for this type of angle
Vinicius, the mascot of the 2016 Summer Olympics hosted by this city, is a mixture of all the Brazilian animals
Buzz the Bee is the mascot of this General Mills cereal
In a 2010 movie Justin Timberlake voiced this sidekick to Yogi Bear
Brian is a dog that can speak on this TV show
On film a Maine harbormaster & his family have their hands full with "Andre", one of these aquatic mammals
In this board game you must solve the case of millionaire Samuel Black, murdered in his own mansion
It's "the classic naval combat game"
Good deeds allow you to climb up, but watch out for the slides in this game where you try to reach the 100 square
Use your skull in all of the activities of this game whose name is a synonym for "skull"
In 2016 news an A.I. program beat a champion of this 2-letter game with 361 pieces
It means to free a slave from bondage
5-letter word meaning to make very happy
If you're 18 you're part of this body of persons entitled to vote
When the moonlight doesn't hit your eye like a big pizza pie, that's this scientific phenomenon
The art of using language with fluency & aptness
A pumper is this type of emergency vehicle
Hit the sand for some fun in one of these vehicles
Ragtop is slang for this type of car
On the job an EMT mostly rides around in one of these
The Arctic Cat brand of these recreational vehicles has been made in Minnesota for over 50 years
Is the birthplace of Western civilization
Is home to the country that produces the most coffee
Is the birthplace of most of the world's major religions
Is where you'd find the Adelie Coast
Is the second-largest in area & population
She left Hogwarts for a new school as Sam in "The Perks of Being a Wallflower"
Imagine you're this 2008 film guy; you're an immortal vampire!  Bella has caught your eye!  But you're in high school... forever!
4 high school friends decide to make their own kind of fashion statement in 2005's "The Sisterhood of" these
Set at John Hughes High, 2001's "Not Another Teen Movie" starred this actor, whom you may know as Captain America
Andie, Blane & Duckie deal with love & H.S. in this "colorful" '86 pic; it's been on cable 1,000 times & you've seen it, right?
In ending a text message exchange, ld is "later," this generic guy
A.D. in dates stands for Anno Domini, which literally means this
In the Army 2lt means this rank
Add 3.37 inches to a yd. to get the unit abbreviated by this letter
In the medical term H&H, one "H" is hematocrit; the other is this blood protein
In 1880 gold was found near this city that would later become Alaska's capital
E.H. Harriman went on an expedition that discovered a new glacier & a new one of these Norwegian-style inlets
The first people came to Alaska some 15,000 years ago across what's called a "land" this
Scientist William Dall charted the coastal features of this 1,100-mile island chain
In 1728 this Dane in Russia's navy made the first of 2 voyages to the North Pacific
The Capitol is the ruling city of this country in "The Hunger Games"
In this 1960 book Scout Finch says Maycomb "was a tired old town when I first knew it"
Part of Middle-earth, Dale was a prosperous town until this dragon killed many men & scared off the rest
In this sci-fi novel by Ernest Cline, teen Wade Watts is devoted to solving puzzles in the virtual utopia known as Oasis
Jacob Portman heads to Cairnholm Island & makes his way out of town to visit her "Home for Peculiar Children"

(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows a diagram on the monitor.)  Cystic fibrosis is caused by a defective one of these hereditary bits of information, found on a chromosome; both parents need to have the faulty one to pass the condition on to a child
The U.S. Tennis Association's suggestion if you're committing this faux pas: "Back up a few inches"
Analysis revealed faulty wiring in an oxygen tank to be the cause of this Apollo mission's crippling explosion
Welcome to the New Age--"My Fault" was on this band's album "Continued Silence"
In John 18:38 he says of Jesus, "I find in him no fault at all"
You could say that this bright star is the top dog in Canis Major
In the group of stars seen here, it's the bright star at the top
What's frequently called the Evening Star isn't a star at all, but this bright planet, "Earth's twin"
In the constellation Gemini, the 2 bright stars at the top symbolize the heads of these twin brothers
A high I.Q. might help you identify this constellation whose name translates to "table"

final_jeopardy.clue: This first name of a 21st century activist was inspired by that of a Pashtun heroine known as the Afghan Joan of Arc
